title: Competency-based Patient Safety and Quality Improvement Education Program for Nursing Students

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental nursing theory and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Hosted by a University Extension Lifelong Education Center for Non-Degree Course Enrollees, Including Job Preparers and Current Nursing Assistants

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain core knowledge for patient safety (e.g., medication error prevention, infection control) with at least 85% accuracy
Learners can apply patient safety-related practical skills (checklist utilization, SBAR communication) with 90% accuracy through simulation-based activities
Learners write case analysis reports using quality improvement tools (PDCA cycle, RCA) and achieve at least 4 points (5-point scale) in peer evaluations
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
